item.title: Implement a Binary Tree Using Typescript
item.description: Introduction The purpose of this article is to implement a binary tree, using Typescript and the concept of “genericity”. Genericity allows us to specify a type for our binary tree (number, string, …). Implementation Single Node Defining the fields class SingleNode<T> { private value: T; private left: SingleNode<T> | null; private right: SingleNode<T> | null; // ... } Defining the constructor class SingleNode<T> { // ... constructor( value: T, left: SingleNode<T> | null = null, right: SingleNode<T> | null = null ) { this.

item.title: CV
item.description: Curriculum Vitae Experience Freelance junior React Developer, SOLARDEV July 2021 Fix bugs Develop React components and React pages Styling with SASS Implement REST routes using Node.js and MongoDB Education Bachelor of Computer Science at Faculté des Sciences Jean Perrin, Lens, France 2019 – now French HS diploma, Science major at Lycée Pablo Picasso, Avion, France 2016-2019 Skills Languages : JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Python, C
